page.title: 01Tannadice Village
page.content: Tannadice stands on the north bank of the River South Esk.There is a modern primary school on a hill near the village and one grocers shop which is also a post office.There is a church,a manse,a village hall,a telephone box,a small park and a few houses.Many of the people who live in the village are elderly.There is hardly any work in the village so people who live there go to work in the nearby towns such as Forfar,Kirriemuir and Brechin. Many years ago Tannadice had a cobbler,a baker,a shoemaker and and a tailor.A policeman lived in a house along from the school.The house had a detention centre.There used to be an inn in Manse Lane.A small carpark opposite the village shop was the site of the village cobbler's house.Although the beedle's house remains intact,there is now no tennant
